snippet: Sergio Castro, 72, is neither doctor nor priest, but he fills a gap in Mexico’s ragged safety net in health care, accepting no money from his patients, who are mostly Mayans.
abstract: San Cristobal de las Casas Journal; Sergio Castro, Mexican healer known as Don Sergio, provides labor-intensive medical care to people for free, providing service to many who otherwise would have fallen through holes in country’s ragged health care system; Mexico has spent decade trying to expand access to medical services, but poverty, mismanagement and negligence have left many areas lacking.
lead_paragraph: Sergio Castro, 72, is neither doctor nor priest, but he fills a gap in Mexico’s ragged safety net in health care, accepting no money from his patients, who are mostly Mayans.

headline.main: In Mexico, a Healer Who Asks for Nothing in Return
headline.print_headline: A Healer Who Asks For Nothing In Return
headline.content_kicker: San Cristóbal de Las Casas Journal
headline.kicker: San Cristóbal de Las Casas Journal
